Implementation: We use Madison's filenaming convention, e.g. "Parks Milwaukee County, Wisconsin 2009". Some use a date range. *Geography_Theme_Year*
Controlled vocab, e.g. Collections, Datasets, Imagery, Maps, Web services, Websites, Other. We mostly use Datasets. Web services and Maps will likley be used too.
Public or Restricted. How can we use to differentiate between UW and UWM restriction?? Or should we use "rights" for that?

This field makes up the URL for the resource in GeoBlacklight. It is visible to the user and is used to create permalinks. If having a readable slug is desired, it is common to use the form institution-keyword1-keyword2.
This value should indicate when the metadata (not the resource itself) was last modified.
There have been two metadata schema versions for GeoBlacklight applications: GeoBlacklight 1.0 (abbreviated to GBL 1.0) and OpenGeoMetadata Aardvark (abbreviated to Aardvark).
second-most prominent value (after Title). User readable text that describes the dataset.
"eng" for most, we get this from the ISO.
We use the ISO "source" for this. For example, Metro Data Resource Center. Can be multivalued.
Always "American Geographical Society Library – UWM Libraries", this is attached to our little SVG icon that displays in other portals!
Line data, Polygon Data, etc.
Transportation, Society, etc.
We're storing an ISO date here, but it is intedned to be human readable. Maybe we should rethink this one?
This fills the "Date Issued" field on the show page.
The "main" year. Doesn't appear to the user except in the Year facet. Should be the same as year in the title (not for range?)
Spatial Keywords, e.g. "Milwaukee", "Wisconsin", "Portland Metro", etc. These get shown to the user and linked to the "place" facet.
Powers the map search. ENVELOPE or WKT syntax ENVELOPE(W,E,N,S) Wrong on some records!
Should also be WENS, overlap ratio boosting in spatial searches.

We use our standard "please see" link and standard language about digital colelctions and copyright. OGM specifies it should be used for more free text description of access rights, etc. Could expand beyond current boilerplate use.
[Controlled vocab](https://opengeometadata.org/ogm-aardvark/#format-values), e.g. shapefile, GeoJSOB, GeoTIFF, etc.
defines external services and references using the CatInterOp approach,  serialized JSON array of key/value pairs. [List of Reference URIs supported](https://opengeometadata.org/reference-uris/)
We display our ArkID here
We have this as "false" for everything right now, but could use it to hide records.
